How does the enzyme work to accelerate a chemical reaction? An enzyme is a protein that interacts with the reactants in biological reactions, causing the reaction to occur about 10-15 times faster. An enzyme will usually speed up reaction by a factor of between 10000 and 101000. Enzymes are specific in their activity. Each enzyme only reacts with a certain molecule and reacts with molecules only in one direction. The relationship between enzyme and substrate molecule is defined by an enzyme-substrate complex (K). This is the result of the enzyme binding to the substrate to form a stable product. The energy required for the reaction is an important consideration in this reaction. It is necessary that there be sufficient energy in the reactants in order to overcome the activation energy. In the chemical reaction, it can be shown that for a reaction to occur there must be an activation energy necessary to cause the molecules to dissociate and form the reaction (K). The higher the activation energy required for a reaction, the less likely it is to occur. The enzyme helps reduce this activation energy by providing the necessary energy so that the reaction will take place. Enzymes are also specific to their substrate. This allows an enzyme to work with a precise substrate. Once bound to the enzyme, the substrate cannot bind to another enzyme in the cell. In order to cause the enzyme and substrate to dissociate from the enzyme-substrate complex, the substrate must meet certain criteria of the enzyme. If the substrate does not meet these criteria then it is said to be non-competitive. The substrate does not compete with inhibitor molecules. The enzyme forms the product and the inhibitor dissociates but is not converted into the reactants. instruction: How has quantum computing impacted the energy industry? What are some potential future applications of this technology?

combined_input: How has quantum computing impacted the energy industry? What are some potential future applications of this technology? rTag ann Post pressure marginpoint
generated_output:
. The company is on track to launch its first quantum computing system within the next year. It sees a potential $160 million in revenue for the first year, and an additional $1.2 billion revenue opportunity over the next decade. IBM is in the final stages of developing its own quantum computing hardware and is on track to launch its first chip in 2019. It also believes it will have $50 million in revenue for the first year, but admits this might not be the company’s first $2 billion market opportunity.
There is an even bigger potential for quantum computing in healthcare where the power of computers can be more broadly useful. Quantum computing could be a gamechanger in drug research and discovery, where chemical compounds can only be tested one at a time for certain types of diseases. IBM already says it hopes to be ready by 2024 or 2025 with quantum computers capable of helping in the process.
One potential area of quantum computing where companies like BP and Cargill are already working with IBM to develop machine learning powered by quantum algorithms
BP's Quantum Computing Research
BP is building a network of collaborators to harness the power of quantum computing. The energy company's researchers are developing machine learning algorithms for weather forecasts and climate change modelling by running quantum simulations.
BP is collaborating with IBM in developing machine learning algorithms to predict the spread of oil and gas reservoirs. This will create a more accurate picture of the reservoirs themselves, resulting in more informed investment decisions.
The energy company is also collaborating with Microsoft (MSFT, Tech30) in developing a quantum computer-enabled weather forecast. By using the power of quantum computing to solve complex equations in the physics of atmospheric dynamics, BP predicts that these weather forecasts can be made more accurate a decade from now.
Cargill's Quantum Computing Research
Cargill, one of the six global leaders in supplying food and agriculture-based products, has been working with IBM since 2017 on a machine learning project to reduce costs. The company was looking to see if it could get more accurate predictions from its models by increasing the number of scenarios that it considers.
The answer was "yes," and now the company is working on predicting how weather data will affect supply in some of its processes that involve products such as corn meal or wheat. It's one of several projects that are using quantum computers to enhance their prediction capabilities, and the company sees them as a way to help in a wide range of applications.
IBM's Quantum Computing Research
IBM has long had a presence in quantum computing, and announced last week that it will be acquiring D-Wave Systems, which makes a quantum computer that's able to solve problems faster than traditional machines.
The move indicates IBM has been building out its Quantum Computing Research. The computer giant's Qiskit team is helping build quantum software and has already created a few tools that are open-source or commercially available.
One potential area of quantum computing where companies like BP and Cargill are already working with IBM to develop machine learning powered by quantum algorithms is predicting the spread of oil. The problem is relatively simple to model, but difficult to predict because the spread is very sensitive to small changes.
It's a similar problem with climate change, and scientists around the world have begun to use simulations from quantum computers to do this. A recent study that appeared in Nature revealed that quantum computing could help in the process of modelling and simulating climate scenarios to produce more precise predictions.

instruction: Is it ethical to use animals for scientific research? What are the arguments for and against this practice? Please provide evidence to support your answer.
prompt: restre Method Ju pressure animal HE
combined_input: Is it ethical to use animals for scientific research? What are the arguments for and against this practice? Please provide evidence to support your answer. restre Method Ju pressure animal HE
generated_output:
ALTH ANIMALS Animal welfare and animal rights
Animals are used in biomedical research in numerous ways, including to test new drugs, investigate how viruses and bacteria invade human cells, and examine the body's response to new treatments. Animal experiments are necessary to test the safety and effectiveness of medical products, including investigating the mechanisms of disease at a molecular level. However, this research is not solely done to develop medical breakthrough cures. Scientist uses animals to learn new information that can improve human health. Some scientists also aim to find ways to replace or reduce the use of animals in research.
Argumentative essay on abortion
The first part of the speech should be the introduction. This section should provide some background on the subject, such as how many babies are aborted each year, how many women decide to get abortions, and what is considered a fetal stage of development under current laws. It should also include your position on the matter and why you are pro-choice or pro-life.
The next section of the essay should be an argument for your side of things. Include details from the speech, such as how many women get abortions because their life is at risk, for medical reasons, or because they believe the baby is deaf or retarded. Give examples of mothers who regret getting an abortion later in life and tell why each mother feels this way.
Argumentative speech about immigration
Immigration is a very hot topic in the United States because it has been a topic of major political controversy and debate for many years. Some people argue that immigrants are bringing crime and poverty to our country and others argue that immigrants are providing new and much needed jobs. These two opposite ideas make up the basic argumentative speech on immigration.
Young immigrants and refugees, on the other hand, are more likely to be working in dangerous jobs. As a result, they are getting sick and injured, and some even die in preventable ways. Many people believe that immigrants are not safe or deserve to be treated like people who have done everything right in their lives.
However, there is no legal or ethical justification for such actions as a result of illegal entry or reentry into the U. Immigration from these countries tends to be very young, which can affect the culture and values of youth. It is clear that immigration can be a positive force on a country's economy and workforce by providing skilled workers in high-paying professions like science or education.
Immigration can also contribute to increasing economic growth through increased consumer and business demand for goods and services. By increasing the overall talent and economic output of a country, immigration can help ensure that people will have opportunities throughout their lives, regardless of age or gender. Immigrants are also often subjected to different standards of health care based on their national origin, leading some to suffer higher rates of disease or injury.
How are animals used in biomedical research?
The use of animals in biomedical research is an essential tool used to advance our understanding of how the body functions, and to develop diagnostics and treatments for human diseases. Animal studies enable the development of potential new therapies for Alzheimer's, AIDS, cancer, cystic fibrosis, diabetes, heart disease, mental disorders, multiple sclerosis and many more conditions.
In the United States, according to the National Institutes of Health Animal Research Use Reporting System AURI Report, over 25 million animals were used in scientific research during 2014. A full 30 percent of these animals were used for cancer, infection and other medical research, and 78 percent of the estimated were used for research purposes.
In addition, over the past several decades, scientists have significantly improved the quality of lives of laboratory animals, and many animals are now kept in environments that are much more comfortable, safe and sanitary than wildlife.
What are animal rights?
Animals have the inherent right to live naturally without human exploitation, just as any other life form on Earth. This means that it makes sense for people to give a thought to animals and be concerned about their well-being and safety.
Animals have a fundamental right to life, a right that is granted to them by nature. Life has value, regardless of its appearance; animals cannot be discarded just because they are not humans or because they cannot speak.
Animal rights have become a controversial issue in modern society because people believe that using animals for food, experimentation, or entertainment is ethically wrong. This belief stems from an argument that animals can feel pain and suffer just as much as humans do. This is not an acceptable approach toward animal rights because animals don't deserve this level of suffering for our benefit.
Animals can feel and suffer, but this pain is not necessarily permanent. Animals can be put through horrific tortures and abuses that humans would not be able to endure. For example, animals cannot be treated as pets in the same way that humans are because they do not have the emotional capacity or intelligence to be considered a companion or even a child.
Why is it ethical to use animals for scientific research?
The use of animals in biomedical research is essential to the development of life-saving treatments for humans and animals. It provides a means to discover the underpinnings of the diseases that kill so many people every year and develop treatments and cures to combat these diseases. The use of animals in research to study biological processes and mechanisms is vital to understanding how diseases develop and what causes them. It is also needed to develop new treatments for diseases and to test potential drugs.
One reason scientists use animals in research is to understand how the human body works and to test new drugs. Animals are able to provide a model for what happens in a person when there is a problem with a certain part of the body. Animals can also be used to study how a drug interacts with other body parts, which can provide clues about how it will affect the human body.

instruction: Artificial intelligence (AI) is the ability of a computer or a robot to perform tasks that normally require human intelligence, such as reasoning, learning, and decision making. Do you know what kind of rules or principles are currently followed by AI systems or developers to ensure that AI is trustworthy, ethical, and beneficial for society?
prompt: r longInteraire pressurerix HE
combined_input: Artificial intelligence (AI) is the ability of a computer or a robot to perform tasks that normally require human intelligence, such as reasoning, learning, and decision making. Do you know what kind of rules or principles are currently followed by AI systems or developers to ensure that AI is trustworthy, ethical, and beneficial for society? r longInteraire pressurerix HE
generated_output:
LLO, WELCOME TO MY
Artificial intelligence (AI) is the ability of a computer or a robot to perform tasks that normally require human intelligence, such as reasoning, learning, and decision making. Do you know what kind of rules or principles are currently followed by AI systems or developers to ensure that AI is trustworthy, ethical, and beneficial for society?
r long InterAires pressrer x hello, welcome to my channel. I’m a researcher and my topic today that I want to talk about is trustworthy artificial intelligence. Now, my name is mingyue zhan. I am a researcher at the university of tulsa. And I study research ethics and my general research area is artificial intelligence. I am very passionate about A.I. because it is about the future of our life and society, and it has a profound impact on the future of our society because A.I. will lead to unbelievable and great benefits and great progress, but I’m also concerned about some risks that might accompany A.I. with some possible negative outcomes or possible misuse. And so, I hope that A.I. can be really trustworthy and beneficial for society to achieve these goals. In order to achieve those goals, A.I. needs to address a variety of technical and social challenges, especially the ethical and societal challenges, and in particular for trustworthy artificial intelligence is an important issue that we need to discuss and study carefully.
One of the reasons is because A.I. already influences our daily lives. For example, I use my phone everyday for searching for information, searching for news, searching for any kind of interesting contents or some information about my personal history that I want to analyze and I want to know more about myself. My bank also uses A.I. to detect my fraud and it might help to prevent me from any possible fraud. Another example is that I drive by an autonomous vehicle. Now, this autonomous vehicle uses A.I. to perform some automated driving to avoid any risk or accidents when it detects dangers, or in an emergency situation. For example, when you accidentally touch the brake pedal in traffic, the autonomous vehicle can quickly detect dangers and help to avoid an accident before any human driver. So, it is important that A.I. systems can adapt rapidly to new situations and learn rapidly to avoid any uncertainties in those situations. So
in order to achieve these goals, A.I. systems need to exhibit some properties to really ensure that A.I. systems are robust, reliable, and can serve the society with respect to those challenges. For these properties, one example is that A.I. systems should also be able to explain themselves or provide explanations. Otherwise, I do not know the reason for why they make some decisions or decisions and we might even feel uncomfortable about accepting those decisions, because now we do not know why they make such decisions. So in order to solve these challenges, many developers including myself have been studying ways to guide and design artificial intelligence to become trustworthy and this is my research topic.
I’ll talk about five important aspects for a trustworthy artificial intelligence system. The first point is there should be transparency and explainability, especially in the decision making procedure. So A.I. systems should also provide explanations or give me explanations for why they make those decisions in the first place. And they can be used as explanations to promote accountability. And that is because a machine doesn’t really speak or can express itself to communicate to us exactly why it is doing certain things in a certain situation. And so, by providing explanations in this case, we can understand how these machine systems make certain decisions. But there might be cases with high dimensional inputs or high dimensional outputs. There are some cases where we do not even understand what information are contained inside the black box. In order to make a robust, reliable decision, we can also add some additional properties to the system, which is the second point of which is there should be diversity in how A.I. systems provide explanations or how A.I. systems make a decision. There should be diversity, so multiple explanations should be provided to evaluate whether those explanations are reliable or not. For example. Even in the decision-making procedure, we can ask for many different explainers, many different input experts, and we should have the different explanations for the different decisions in that case. So we can achieve diversity to improve the transparency and explainability for A.I. systems for that process.
And the second point that I will discuss is fairness. So AI systems should also be fair. For example, if I ask an autonomous vehicle to take me to work by one certain route, the autonomous vehicle should not make decisions about whether it’s safe to choose the traffic light as an optimal driver or the traffic jam as an optimal way to find work. And those decisions based on some ethical principles or moral principles can also improve the performance or can improve the transparency for the AI system, if AI systems make decisions based on those moral principles. And so, we can ask those questions. Those decisions about whether those policies are fair or not. And so, AI systems should also be accountable and trust should be established with the public in these cases. The third important aspect is that AI systems should also be robust and reliable and reliable. This includes the ability to make long term decisions. So I should not ask an autonomous vehicle to make decisions immediately because it may not be able to make decisions in the future. And so, it is important that AI systems should be reliable for the long term. And so, a trustworthy AI system should also make long-term decisions in the future as well.
Now, for the fourth important aspect, AI systems should be socially responsible, and socially responsible. That means that a trustworthy AI system should also take into account these societal principles and values in the decision making procedure or the policy that we want to choose or the decisions that they make as well. And in practice, AI systems are adopted to make decisions or to make autonomous decisions in the world. And so, they should be also accountable for their decisions and trustworthy too. So socially responsible can improve transparency, so we can understand why those AI systems make decisions and what are their moral principles? what are their principles from which they derive their decisions that AI systems make?
Now, for the fifth important point, I think the AI system should also be safe because it can have this unintended consequence and this unpredictable and unpredictable consequences. In fact, I was reading some news in China on an autonomous vehicle that just killed a pedestrian. The driver did not drive the car at the same time and so, the driverless car was driving on the road by itself and killed the pedestrian on the road. And so, AI systems are already very powerful and now they can learn quickly. And they start to replace some tasks that have been already done by humans for decades or for hundreds of years. For example, the driverless car can take us to work everyday and they might take our job as well unless the driverless cars can also explain why they make decisions because we want to make sure that this A.I. system is reliable and socially responsible and can make decisions based on the ethical principles that we want. And lastly, I think it’s important that AI systems to have also ethical principles, which are very important. So, we should first ask these fundamental questions before we start developing AI in the first place. The three important points are we want to evaluate AI systems for making decisions. How will trustworthiness be established for these AI systems? Can we trust AI systems? And how can we make those decisions. Who is responsible for evaluating those decisions for those AI systems? I think we should first establish those fundamental principles. And then once we establish those principles, then we start developing AI systems for those purposes and for those decisions at the first time. So thank you for your time. It’s about 15 minutes that I talked about these important principles and these important factors as well. And next time, I’ll be happy to speak more about these AI ethics and how they are implemented into practice as well. Thank you.

Naturists, nudists, naturism, camping, swimming, clothing optional
Natural Living - 31 Jan 2020 at 07:35
Rules of being a Naturist - Naturistes Canada
This post contains the English language of rules, which is the only language accepted. French and other languages are not accepted on this post. It is recommended that you find and stay in a community that shares your values and preferences. If you can't find such a community, you may have to put up with what you do not like. You will also probably need to compromise on some of your own values. At least two of the following criteria must be met for a naturist camping site to qualify.
1. All members of a naturist camping site must wear a minimum of a bathing suit (see below) which covers the genitalia, the buttocks and the upper third of the thighs, while swimming in or entering the lake or while sitting in the sauna. A minimum of a bathing suit must be placed while hiking along the property of the site, between the site and the lakeshore, while hiking on a marked road and while hiking in the forest.
2. The minimum of a bathing suit must at least be worn by the members of the site who are in contact with the other members of the sites, whether they are members of natural campsites or not, and members of natural areas (for example, people who come to fish on the beach or walk on marked trails in the forest near the site ). For the entire day, members of a naturist camping site who participate in an activity must wear a minimum of a bathing suit (see below). A bathing suit worn by members who are not involved in any activity is not considered acceptable.
3. The site must provide a bathing area (for example, a swimming pool, hot tub, and/or whirlpool) that can be used for swimming, hiking, camping, and other outdoor activities. If the property is used for the site, there must be no sign of activities that take place outside the naturist campground. The naturist camping site cannot be set up as or be used as a swimming pool that is also used for activities such as swimming, hiking, camping, or other outdoor activities.
If you participate in activities outside of Naturisme, you may find that Naturist activities and attire are not appropriate for you. If this is the case, you may ask the participants present to leave their clothed clothing at their next arrival.
4. The naturist camping site can have a natural bathing area within which the naturist campsite can be used. If the property is used for the site, there must be no sign of activities that take place outside the naturist campground (as defined above). If naturist camping sites are used as swimming pools, hot tubs, whirlpools, etc., they can be used only for swimming, hiking, camping, or other outdoor activities.
5. A naturist camping site can be used for activities only outside the site and without the participation of people who are not members of Naturisme. If this is the case, the naturist camping site will be closed for naturist activities whenever naturist participation is allowed outside the site. The naturist camping site may only be used by naturist campsites when naturist participation is not allowed. You may find that Naturismo activities and attire are not appropriate for you if you participate in activities outside Naturismo. You may seek the participants in attendance to remove their clothed gear at their next arrival. 1. All participants must wear a bathing suit that covers the genitalia and the buttocks when using any naturist campsite. You may be required to cover your genitalia with your hand, a bathing suit, or at the direction of the site coordinator. This does not include a hat or a cap that covers only the genitalia, even if a hat or a cap covers the thighs as well.
If any naturist campsite becomes impractical due to weather conditions or other reasons beyond the control of its owners, you may opt not to participate in the naturist activity. If you choose not to participate in an activity or an activity that is part of that naturist camping site, your membership fees are non-refundable. If you participate in a naturist activity hosted at another naturist campsite, you may opt not to participate in the naturist activity at the site, but you will be required to pay a membership fee to continue to do so. instruction: Apples are a delicious and nutritious fruit that are widely consumed around the world. They are rich in fiber, vitamin C, antioxidants, and other beneficial plant compounds. Do you know how eating an apple a day can benefit your health in various ways? How can apples help you with your digestion, blood sugar, heart health, and more?
prompt: r oddInter Ju Variable margin HE
combined_input: Apples are a delicious and nutritious fruit that are widely consumed around the world. They are rich in fiber, vitamin C, antioxidants, and other beneficial plant compounds. Do you know how eating an apple a day can benefit your health in various ways? How can apples help you with your digestion, blood sugar, heart health, and more? r oddInter Ju Variable margin HE
generated_output:
ART DISEASE Risk
Apple is your best buddy this season A healthy diet is essential to keeping your heart healthy, especially as you age. A healthy meal plan includes many fruits and vegetables to lower the risk of heart disease. Apples have anti-inflammatory properties that can help reduce many unhealthy diseases, including heart disease. Eating this snack can provide the following benefits:
Apples have low levels of sodium, which can be beneficial for your blood pressure. If high blood pressure causes the heart to work harder than it should, this strain can increase the risk of heart disease. But apples contain potassium and magnesium, which can help relax the arteries and reduce tension on the heart.
Reduce harmful cholesterol in the blood
Cholesterol is an important substance found in the body that helps create cell membranes, hormone production, and vitamin absorption in the body. But too much high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol, known as a “good” cholesterol, can build up in the blood and damage the heart or blood vessels.
Apples can help lower harmful low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol levels by removing excess cholesterol from the blood and increasing HDL cholesterol levels. A small study showed that appetite suppression helped lower total cholesterol and LDL cholesterol, but with improvements in blood flow and a heart-healthy diet.
It can help cut down on inflammation
As you age, inflammation becomes more likely. Heart disease is a common condition that can be caused by chronic inflammatory conditions. Fortunately, you’ll find enough antioxidants in apples to keep your heart healthy and fight chronic inflammation.
Apples with apple juice concentrate are great for your heart and overall health.
Because they are rich in antioxidants, apples may help prevent and inhibit cancer. They contain ursolic acid, phenolic acids, isoflavonoids, and solanine, which are powerful ingredients that fight tumor growth in the body.
Apples also contain an antioxidant-rich nutrient called catechin, which can inhibit the growth of cancer. These chemical compounds have been linked to a lower risk of obesity, breast cancer, and colorectal cancer.
It can help normalize blood sugar levels
Fiber in apples can help lower blood sugar levels in diabetic patients. Some studies have seen that apples can lower their levels. Fiber helps digestion while the antioxidants found in apples, including catechins and quercetin, help remove harmful free radicals in the body.
It can help with digestion
Our digestion is the body’s way of breaking down food and nutrients from food into smaller molecules. This way can absorb those nutrients in the body. When the digestive system is not functioning well, it can have a devastating effect on health.
Apples are abundant in fiber, which has been shown to reduce constipation and ease digestion. Apples also contain the fiber pectin, which helps protect against free radicals that can lead to inflammation, cancer, and heart disease.
Its natural sugar makes it a perfect candy choice
Apples are a natural source of sugar, so one of the best things to do after eating a piece of apple is to eat a little, which helps to regulate and maintain blood glucose levels. This fruit is rich in energy and helps you eat less over time.
Apples also provide us with natural vitamins and minerals without adding calories. A large amount of pectin in them helps the body to feel full after eating, helping you consume less in the end.
Some other benefits of apples:
Stops the production of acne-causing acids in the skin thanks to their skin-nourishing properties.
Its high level of antioxidants can reduce aging signs.
It protects the liver from damage and fights inflammation thanks to its fiber content.
It improves bone health due to the presence of vitamin A and C.
It helps reduce bad cholesterol thanks to its ability to absorb excess body fat from food.
Helps prevent obesity, thanks to the presence of antioxidants that limit fat accumulation.
It helps maintain the structure of the skin thanks to its vitamins A and E that serve as anti-aging agents. As a result, it helps prevent stretch marks during and after pregnancy.
Takes care of your metabolism.
Can you eat too much of this sweet delicacy?
Eating apples has many benefits for your heart. Thanks to the amount of fiber they contain, they also have a low risk of causing high blood pressure, heart disease, or diabetes.
Apples also contain vitamin C, potassium, magnesium, iodine, iron, and phosphorus. The apples are good for digestion, which helps to maintain the shape, strength, and function of the bones. It also helps with blood clotting and blood circulation.
It is important to note that a daily intake of 300 grams or 1 1/2 cups of apples is the amount recommended as part of a balanced diet, as excessive consumption can be harmful to your health.
Eating a fresh apple a day will help prevent many ailments and provide you with numerous benefits.
The health benefits of eating an apple include: 1) A low calorie and low-fat snack.

Next articleHow Does an Apple Store Work?

instruction: Is it possible to prevent a cardiac arrest by forcefully expelling air from the lungs repeatedly?
prompt: embed longInter Ju Variable margin HE
combined_input: Is it possible to prevent a cardiac arrest by forcefully expelling air from the lungs repeatedly? embed longInter Ju Variable margin HE
generated_output:
MODYNAMICS: LOW BLOOD VOLUME AND LOW BLOOD PRESSURE (HYPOTENSION) This is a life threatening medical condition when the level of blood in the body drops below normal causing a drop in blood pressure leading to inadequate amount of blood supply to vital organs.
Low blood volume is not a disease in itself but a problem associated with serious life-threatening situations such as bleeding, severe dehydration (loss of fluid) and severe burns. The signs and symptoms of low blood volume may not be evident in the early stages of blood reduction, as there are many factors that might mask these symptoms and signs.
The patient may be alert, and the blood pressure may be normal, which suggests that the body will adapt to this situation by reducing blood flow to tissues, and increasing blood flow to vital organs. The first sign of symptoms would occur when most of the body’s blood volume has been reduced.
The body experiences a sudden drop in blood volume that would cause a sudden drop in blood pressure leading to acute hypovolemic shock. Acute hypovolemic shock is a more fatal condition than chronic hypovolemic shock, which occurs gradually and more cautiously.
Factors Related to Blood Volume Blood volume: Blood volume is the total amount of blood that is in the circulation at a given time. Blood volume is determined by the factors such as lean body mass and plasma volume that depends on the amount of liquids a person has in their body.
Blood volume depends on the amount of fluids in the body, lean body mass, and total hemoglobin volume. Weight and lean body mass are the two main predictors of the amount of blood in the circulatory system.
The amount of lean body mass is determined by the total body fat, bone mass and organs like muscles with the water in that mass accounting for the normal plasma volume. Blood volume is also affected by cardiac output (how much blood the heart is pumping per minute).
This has a direct relation to blood pressure, as more blood in the body means higher blood pressure. Blood volume could also be affected by hormonal changes, resulting in hemodilution which refers to the dilution of blood by other fluids in the circulatory system.
Some hormones such as aldosterone, ADH, which is the hormone that activates vasopressin, causes the kidneys to retain more fluids.
The hormone epinephrine, commonly known as adrenalin, causes dilution through the effects it has on blood flow. Epinephrine can be found in the bloodstream by the body in different ways; it can be released directly from the adrenal glans in response to stress or the adrenals can be stimulated by the action of the hormone ACTH that is released by the adrenal cortex.
Hormones like progesterone and cortisol that are produced during pregnancy can also have effects on blood volume. Blood volume may also be affected by changes in body temperature, which is regulated by the hormone, thyroxine, also known as T4. Thyroxine can cause a drop in blood volume leading to a decrease in blood pressure and a decrease in red blood cell production.
There are also different types of blood cells called erythropoiesis, which controls the way red blood cells in our body are produced. Erythropoiesis requires a balance of proteins, minerals and vitamins that can affect the total blood volume in the body. The hormone prolactin can stimulate the production of erythrocytes in the bone marrow. It regulates blood volume and the amount of iron in the blood.
Loss of blood volume also occurs in the form of bleeding. Types of Bleeding:
Bleeding is classified into three types: venous, arterial and intracraneal bleeding. Venous bleeding is a major contributor for blood loss. Arterial bleeding may be internal or external. Venous bleeding is one of the most common types of hemorrhage.
It is a direct result of a direct tear in a blood vessel. Venous bleed is often experienced through small wounds and cuts in the skin. It can also be experienced during surgery, which is also called intra-operative bleeding.
Arterial bleeding is a more serious form of bleeding. It is caused by the tearing of large blood vessels, and is also more traumatic compared to venous bleeding.
Intracranial bleeding is a type of blood loss that occurs in the brain. It can be classified into two types: subdural, which is a collection of blood beneath the top layer of the brain, and inter-cerebral, which is the collection of blood between the different layers of the brain. The blood clots form under pressure and reduce the amount of blood flow to the brain area.
Blood may also be lost due to severe hemorrhage such as when a person suffers from ruptured arteries or extensive wounds.
The hemodynamic balance is related to many physiological and physical variables, which cause a reduction in the volume of circulating blood, which could either be short-term (<6 hours) or longer-term (<24 hours). Hypovolemia can be caused by fluid loss, which includes dehydration, urine output, or excessive bleeding, which is a condition that occurs more often in the elderly.
Severe loss of blood volume by loss of blood, which often occurs during a major injury or surgery, is a severe medical condition that can result in shock, low blood pressure and ultimately death if not treated urgently.
Hypovolemia or decreased amount of blood in the circulatory system can be identified through the physical or physiological factors that cause changes in the blood volume. The most serious hypovolemia is defined by the reduction in blood volume to the extent that it has become a hypovolemic shock.
Hypovolemia is divided in to two types, acute or chronic (1).
Acute hypovolemia occurs on the sudden short-term changes in blood volume. This condition causes a low blood pressure, low cardiac output, which is characterized by a decrease in venous return.
Chronic hypovolemia occurs gradually as the blood volume is reduced. Chronic hypovolemia often goes unnoticed until signs of symptoms become visible. This condition is diagnosed when a low blood pressure occurs.

Cardiac Arrest Hypovolemic Shock Hemotherapy
Blood volume is the total amount of blood that is in the circulation at a given time. It depends on factors such as how much of each is in the system, and how much water or plasma is in the body.
A person's heart may not be able to produce sufficient blood to meet the demands of the body if less blood is circulating through the body.
Hypovolemic shock is the most serious form of shock, and happens when a person experiences a sudden decrease in blood volume that causes their blood pressure to drop.
Dehydration and loss of blood can cause a person to develop hypovolemic shock. Lack of water or loss of fluids from diarrhea can cause the blood to thin and decrease the blood volume in the body, leading to hypovolemic shock.
In cases of major trauma, blood loss can cause hypovolemic shock to develop. Loss of more than one liter of blood over five to 10 minutes may be life threatening.
A person may have blood loss due to internal bleeding, severe trauma, or surgery.
Hypovolemic shock may affect all organs, and may affect the liver, the endocrine glands, and the kidneys and bladder. Hormonal levels in the bloodstream change due to the loss of water and will impact the entire body; for example, sodium levels may change. In response to the low blood volume, the heart will try to deliver more blood to the brain and muscles. This means that the heart will have to work harder, which can cause further stress on the body.
Without enough water in the system, the blood thickens, and the heart can’t always provide enough blood to the organs.
Without proper treatment, the heart weakens even more, and the kidneys will not be able to eliminate the waste in the bloodstream. A person may start to feel light-headed, dizzy, and experience blurred vision. They may also complain of difficulty concentrating.
The symptoms and signs of hypovolemic shock include the following:
Cool skin or pale skin (lack of blood flow and blood volume)
A person also may experience blurred vision or impaired thought processes, depending on how severe their condition is.
Symptoms and signs of the heart not be able to pump enough blood through the body are as follows:
Fluid retention in the lower legs (due to loss of electrolytic balance and the heart not being strong enough to pump enough blood through the body)
Hypovolemic shock is more likely to develop in someone who becomes dehydrated if they have an illness that prevents them from being able to drink or keep down water and fluids.
When an emergency medicine physician or nurse is called to a person’s home, they may be called to someone who has dehydration due to illness, or someone who is vomiting and unable to keep down fluids and has decreased urine production (due to diuretics or excess fluid loss). Blood losses due to trauma as well as a person’s inability to rehydrate at home may require transfer to a hospital.
Hypovolemic shock may occur if a person loses a significant amount of fluid in the short term. Surgery, excessive vomiting, sepsis, and excessive bleeding from trauma or ulcers, and other types of excessive fluid losses can lead to this condition.
Sometimes, hypovolemic shock develops over a period of days or weeks. Low fluid intake may cause a gradual decrease in blood volume. This reduction in blood volume will occur because the body decreases fluid loss by decreasing urine output, which can worsen the electrolytic condition that is part of the condition of dehydration. This can lead to an acute state of shock.
Another mechanism where hypotension can lead to acute hypovolemia and shock is by causing the release of circulating clotting factors, leading to hemorrhage and eventual hypovolemic shock,
Early signs include fatigue, nausea and headaches, but these symptoms do not always present themselves in this manner. People with low blood pressure may have more of a “foggy” or light-headed feeling, whereas people with low red blood cell count (or anemia) that will result in their suffering from hypovolemic shock may not feel it at all.
The symptoms of anemia also progress slowly, and the body adapts to some extent. Some people have high or low levels of iron in their blood due to malnutrition or an underlying condition. When someone has mild anemia, they may not have any signs.
Certain people are at higher risk if they develop hypovolemic shock (for example, if they cannot replace salt and other substances in the body, such as people with heart failure or poor kidney function).
When a person has hypovolemic shock, they can be in respiratory distress; they may experience chest pain, confusion, sweating, and dizziness or loss of consciousness. There can be other neurologic signs and symptoms, including altered tone and reflexes of the muscles. They may be unable to fully take in air through their lungs.
The diagnosis of hypovolemic shock will be made based on physical examination and an understanding of the person’s medical history.
When a person is dehydrated and experiences hypovolemic shock, an examination will be done to check their pulse, determine their blood pressure reading, and to assess their skin. Other symptoms include:
The heart may be beating more quickly than usual, or the pulse may be weak and the blood pressure may be low. People may have a “glassy” look to their eyes and have a rapid respiration rate of 15 to 20 breaths per minute with a shallow chest expansion.
Hypovolemic shock may also be caused by the use of certain medications that cause severe allergic shock, which is when certain the body's immune responses responds to certain drugs.
Hypovolemic shock can be diagnosed when symptoms such a person’s blood volume drops too low, often leading to death.

APA formatted 8th Edition.Course Project: Personal Health & CPRProject DescriptionHuman Development & PersonalityThis assignment is to help you in preparation for a Personal Health & CPR class. In this class, you will be responsible for administering cardiopulmonary resuscitation. Before taking the class, however, you must pass your state approved CPR certification. This assignment is designed to introduce you to the concepts of personal health and fitness and how they relate to the concepts of the Personal Health and Family course. For this assessment, discuss the importance of your physical, mental, and emotional health for both you personally and for the family members you interact with on a daily basis. Address the following in your paper: Describe your understanding of fitness and physical activities. Explain how fitness is important to your health.How would completing this assignment help prepare you for passing your state approved CPR certification class?Provide at least three scholarly resources in this assessment.Proper paper format according to APA writing style is required.Proper APA cover page, abstract, and references are required per the APA style guide.You should keep a Word document with your assignment in it, including this cover page, abstract, and proper reference page, to upload at the end of the assignment.This assessment uses a rubric.InstructionsGrading for this assignment will be based on answer quality, logic/organization of the paper, and language and writing skills, using the rubric found in the Course Guide.Please take a moment to review the rubric for the criteria that will be used to evaluate your assignment.Assignment Scoring GuideInstructor ExpectationsProficientA/FairA-SuperiorB+GoodBNeeds ImprovementC-DevelopingDProficient4003600A/Fair3603900A-3203500B+ Superior300280A or B
Assignment 2: The Role of APA in Research
The assignment is 1 page APA STYLE.
For Assignment 2, in no less than 150 words, share with your classmates the following:In a nutshell (briefly), what is the American Psychological Association (APA)? What is APA’s primary purpose when regulating psychology and psychological research?As human beings, we all have the right to make choices in life, including our choice of treatment for mental health and psychological problems. Psychiatrists, psychologists, social workers, nurses, and others in the helping professions have a tremendous opportunity to influence the life path for people with mental health and psychological issues who are under their care and guidance and/or those they treat. Is it possible for individuals in these areas to have a bad influence on their clients? How can these individuals (and their clients) avoid this from happening?Course Project: Role of a Healthcare Administrator
Course Project: Role of a Healthcare Administrator
Course Project: Role of a Healthcare AdministratorProject DescriptionThe course project requires the submission of a scholarly paper whereby you will complete a research paper that analyzes the role of a health care administrator. This course project has 3 phases: Phase 1, Phase 2 and Phase 3. You will review the attached Course Project: Role of a Healthcare Administrator Guidelines document for Phase 1 for details.Phase 3 – Summarize the role and importance of communication skills, interpersonal skills, writing, management skills, and other key characteristics in the daily operations of a health facility.In addition, complete the following for Phase 3: Select an agency of a healthcare administrator that has either employed a healthcare administrator, or is considering employing a healthcare administrator. If you can locate a hospital within close proximity, it would be beneficial to you in completing your term paper. Research the website and provide background information on the facility or a current healthcare administrator who works at the facility. The assignment is to use the information provided and synthesize ideas from the information provided as a framework for your paper. You will use this information to create a minimum 3-5-page scholarly paper about the healthcare administrator and the facility.The assignment is to include the following:· A complete title page· Executive summary, no longer than 10% of total manuscript and used only after the conclusion of the discussion· A minimum of 5 (five) or more content scholarly references, not references from class assignments and not more than 3 (three) references from the same publication· A minimum of 10 (ten) or more quotes (text) with correct APA citationsPhase 2 – Write a summary for Phase 1.· Title page· Executive summary, no longer than 10% of total manuscript and used only after the conclusion of the discussion· Abstract, no more than 250 words· Introduction· A complete title page· Reference list· Review of literature· Discussion· Conclusion· A minimum of 5 (five) or more content scholarly references, not references from class assignments and not more than 3 (three) references from the same publication· A minimum of 10 (ten) or more quotes (text) with correct APA citationsNote:· Content: Students may use the writing and guidelines for the Phase 1 Term Paper with slight modifications to complete Phase 2. Students will develop a 500 to 700-word summary for Phase 2.· Format: Content will be evaluated for style, grammar, punctuation, sentence structure, clarity, spelling, capitalization, and other grammatical elements. Students will incorporate the concepts of APA style from the syllabus and use a variety of APA references. APA citations will be used. A grammar guide can be accessed at https://owl.english.purdue.edu/owl/resource/747/01/index.html. In addition, the APA Style Website offers helpful explanations and examples of APA style.

instruction: What are some of the most impactful projects that Lionel Messi’s charity has undertaken?
prompt: r longInter fog pressure margin HE
combined_input: What are some of the most impactful projects that Lionel Messi’s charity has undertaken? r longInter fog pressure margin HE
generated_output:
was on the pitch Lionel Messi will help his compatriot and Argentina team-mate Papu Gómez convert his penalty in a shootout against France to reach the final of the world cup, The moment was crucial for Tite, because It was his first game since he had surgery in August and was forced to be absent from the last three games. The coach wanted the best player in the world to help win a final and with only a few months left before his farewell to the selection, this may not be the first time he has helped his friend.
In this selection, of course, Tite has done everything possible to give Messi the best moments in his career, always giving him the chance to be the leader and show himself as a true hero in the team. From the very beginning, The number 30 has been the focus of the coach’s strategy.
in South American Cupin the Copa América final against Chile in Brazil last year was the best example that Tite has given Messi space. When his team needed him most, in a very difficult situation, the Brazilian bench put him on the pitch and he immediately opened the scoring from the penalty spot and later contributed to Gabriel Jesus’ goal that put Brazil ahead. Later, in the last five minutes, an ill-conceived challenge by the Brazilian midfielder Coutinho was the cause of a penalty shot, which, at the age of 34, was converted by the Argentine captain.
Since that moment in South America, Tite has tried to continue betting on the seven-time ballon d’Or. He has always been clear in the use of the number 10 in front of him and in the final days of the World Cup he demonstrated once again that he will always give the best opportunity for everyone to contribute with the maximum.
And he did it by putting Messi on the pitch as a starter at the peak of Brazil’s performance, giving him the freedom to make decisions, which is not an easy task. As in the game in Brazil, we saw him take and kick the ball on the corner in the final of the Copa América in 2019. Messi helped himself and the team.
Alternative Messi
Tite’s alternative in Argentina
From a tactical point of view, it would have been easier for the selection to use Messi as a substitute, but the coach decided to use him at the best time for the game, giving him some room to work in the match from the very first minute, something he missed a lot of the time while in Paris. At the beginning of the World Cup, the coach did it and as a reward he put the 34-year-old star at the peak of Argentina’s biggest win.
See also Kids' favorite foods in 21st century will leave you surprised.
Messi’s charity projects
His charitable work is important to him
Lionel Messi, the 10th in Paris Saint-Germain’s football team, is known for his dedication to charity.
In 2010, Lionel Messi and teammates Javier Mascherano and Carlos Tevez created a charity foundation in his native Argentina to donate to orphanages in Buenos Aires and other underserved areas across the country.
The charity has grown with donations from friends and fans, with the number rising from 22,230 in 2012 to 488,016 in 2013. With the help of his family, in 2017, Messi created a foundation in Barcelona that donated 49.7m Spanish pounds to charitable projects. In 2019, he won the Gillette Global Community Champions award for his humanitarian efforts, specifically his organization for underprivileged children in Argentina. He has repeatedly mentioned his desire to help vulnerable children in Qatar ahead of the World Cup.
Demonstrating the great generosity of the football superstar, it was revealed that he donated a significant sum to aid the victims of the earthquake in Turkey.
With the World Cup being held in his homeland, Messi had the opportunity to visit vulnerable children in Qatar on December 7 and gave 700 signed Messi kits made by the sportswear brand Nike as gifts.
On November 21, the seven-time Ballon d’Or winner announced his foundation’s donation of $100,000 to help victims of the earthquake in Turkey.
Describing the earthquake as “a disaster that leaves everyone in shock and pain”, the 35-year-old footballer expressed his pain in an emotional message on his Instagram account.
See also Aston Villa: Gerrard says 'it'll be a disaster if Rangers keep losing to me'
“A catastrophe that leaves you in shock and disbelief. I feel very sad for the loss of life and I am praying for recovery,” the message continues.
“The people of Turkey, Syria, and many surrounding countries will need help on many scales for a long time. I’m working with my family’s foundation to make sure we can make the biggest donations we can to help as many people as possible.
According to FIFA, the FIFA Foundation will donate one million Swiss francs to the rebuilding of stadiums affected by the earthquake.
Another humanitarian action taken by Messi in the early days of the World Cup was to bring a team of children’s footballers from the Gaza Strip as part of an initiative aimed at uniting the Palestinians.

Social Studies Grade 8: People, Places, and Environments: Standard 8
Essential Question: How do our government, economics, and the environment interact to affect our society?
Unit: Political Systems and Structures
A. Analyze the structure and function of a political system, such as a constitutional republic, and the impact of major historical events within the society and the government. (Exemplars Alignment: Representative Democracy, The Role of Citizenship)
1. Analyze the structure and function of a monarchy, an oligarchy, an aristocracy, a theocracy, a communism, and a democracy within a society and the government.
2. Describe the impact of major historical events within the government system, such as the Magna Carta, the Bill of Rights, the Enlightenment, the French Revolution, and political parties.
B. Analyze how the political system and structure are influenced by the economy and history. (Exemplars Alignment: Civil Liberties)
3. Explain how changes to a political system, such as the influence of the media, social pressure, economic conditions, religious beliefs, and foreign influences, impact a society.
C. Evaluate the influence of a government system on the environment and the economy. (Exemplars Alignment: Rights and Responsibilities, Civil Liberty and Dual Government)
4. Explain the impact of political systems and their structures on the environment and the economy.
D. Examine the impact of government policies and structures on its citizens. (Exemplars Alignment: People, Places and Environments)
5. Define the concept of civic participation and explain how a citizen expresses his or her participation in the community.
6. Describe how a government influences its citizens to engage in community service.
E. Examine the history of political systems in relation to major historical events and the rights and responsibilities of citizens. (Exemplars Alignment: Rights and Responsibilities, People, Places and Environments)
7. Analyze the interaction of government, economics, and the environment in a society.
Social Studies Grade 8: People, Places, and Environments: Standard 10
Essential Question: Why is our society and government constantly changing?
Unit: A Global Perspective: Standard 1
A. Evaluate issues from a global perspective. (Exemplars Alignment: Government in a Global Society)
1. Describe similarities and differences between societal organizations in several different countries.
2. Identify and describe a global social issue, such as world hunger, and explain possible consequences of current choices or trends.
B. Describe the influence of geopgraphy on trade routes and the development of culture. (Exemplars Alignment: People in the Past)
3. Describe the relationship between physical geography and culture of various societies and the influence of geography on trade routes.
Essential Question:How does human society form and grow over time?
Unit:The Study of History: Standard 1
A. Understand the impact of significant events throughout U.S. and world history on the growth of the country, its people, and its economic and political systems. (Exemplars Alignment: The Growth of the United States)
1. Analyze how societal decisions and conflicts within U.S. and world society have affected people and the growth of the country, its economy, and its political systems.
B. Explore U.S. and world historical developments, social movements, and events.
(Exemplars Alignment: Developments and Change: In U.S. and World History)
2. Describe how specific historical developments, social movements, and events have impacted U.S. and world society.
C. Identify the effects of human decisions and actions within a time period in both U.S. and world history. (Exemplars Alignment: Consequences and Celebrations: In U.S. and World History)
3. Explain how U.S. and world societal decisions and actions affected the people during a specific period, and how these decisions and actions affected subsequent events.
D. Analyze the history of the world and U.S. in which the student lives and describe the changes in societal development over time, including key issues, events, and actions by people. (Exemplars Alignment: Continuity and Change: In U.S. and World History)
4. Describe the history of the world and U.S. in which the student lives; explore the continuity and changes of significant issues, events, and actions by people over time.
E. Annotate significant events in the U.S. and world history. (Exemplars Alignment: Annotating the Past)
5. Identify and provide evidence of the causes and consequences of events in the pre-Columbian period, the era of exploration, the colonial period, the Founding fathers and the Constitution, the era of slavery, western expansion and conquest, the Civil War, Reconstruction, the Industrial Revolution, the Progressive Era, the Great Depression, World Wars I and II, the Cold War, the Civil Rights/Women’s Rights Era, and the present time.
F. Analyze how different perspectives of history influence views and conclusions about historical events and people.
G. Describe the impact of history on current events nationally and globally. (Exemplars Alignment: Connections Through Time and Space: In U.S. and World History)
6. Describe and explain how and why historical developments of the past impact contemporary society.
H. Evaluate the role of historical events in the development of current global issues, conflict, and cooperation. (Exemplars Alignment: Connections Through Time and Space: In U.S. and World History)
7. Explain how and why historical developments of the past affect contemporary cooperation and issues within a nation and globally.
Essential Question: What do we learn from studying a variety of historical perspectives?
Unit: People: Standard 1/2
A. Explain the ways in which social studies skills and inquiry methods enhance personal and social development. (Exemplars Alignment: People and Their Environments)
1. Explain how the study of human geography benefits the individual and society.
2. Describe how the study of economic systems enhance the individual and society.
B. Describe the roles that social studies can play in the development and improvement of life. (Exemplars Alignment: People and Their Environments)
3. Explain the contribution of social studies skills to the development of the life skills necessary to succeed in present-day society.
C. Analyze the influence of historical events on personal and social development. (Exemplars Alignment: People in the Past)
4. Describe how learning about the history of your family, your community, and your nation will affect your growth.
Essential Question: Why is history important?
A. Describe the impact of significant events, individuals, and trends in U.S. and world history
on the growth of the country, its people, and its economic and political systems. (Exemplars Alignment: Growth and Development of the U.S.)
2. Provide examples of how changes have impacted U.S. and world society.
C. Discuss historical events that happened during the time and place the student lives and explain how these events compare with events of yesterday and the world.
Essential Question:What factors determine the success or failure of an enterprise?
Unit: The Study of Economics: Standard 1
A. Understand how scarcity limits choices and requires a rational decision-making process. (Exemplars Alignment: How Is Our Economy Connected To Our Communities?)
1. Describe ways people make choices using scarcity as input.
2. Explain how to make decisions in a complex, changing world.
B. Describe and analyze the relationship between economic and environmental costs and benefits. (Exemplars Alignment: Our Nation’s Economic Foundation)
3. Explain ways in which decisions and actions impact people and the environment.
C. Analyze how and why decisions and actions, taken both individually and collectively, affect human development and the environment.(Exemplars Alignment: Our Nation’s Economic Foundation)
4. Analyze how and why decisions and actions impact human development and the environment.
Essential Question: What do we need for all citizens of a democracy to be successful?
Unit: Rights and Responsibilities: Standard 1
A. Understand the origin, purpose, and impact of the U.S. Constitution. (Exemplars Alignment: Rights and Responsibilities)
1. Identify and describe the purpose of the U.S. Constitution.
2. Explain the significance of the Bill of Rights, and discuss how citizens exercise rights and responsibilities.

Case study: A 24-year-old female has been working in the casino industry for three months. She began smoking when she was 14. She has never consulted a healthcare provider regarding her tobacco habit. Her friends and family discourage her from smoking, but she continues. The company she works for has a policy that requires all employees to wear masks when inside buildings for safety purposes. Today the owner of the casino has provided all employees, and especially the female in question, with a box of cigarettes and a bottle of lighter fluid. The package is marked “Open Immediately” and has “Welcome New Employee” imprinted on the side. The employee notices the note, but not the warning label on the bottle, the contents of which are not obvious. She is pleased to receive a generous gift during her first few months of employment and ignores the warning label. The employee is unaware that the lighter fluid can be very flammable and dangerous when inhaled. She inhales the fumes and is burned from head to toe. She is in shock and her skin is red and blistering. She requires care in a burn unit. She experiences severe pain and requires opiates for the pain management. In addition to treatment for her burns, she also needs therapy and ongoing psychological support. She undergoes several surgeries due to contractures caused by scarring. She is left with permanent scarring and disfigurement. She is no longer capable of working as a bartender in any area of the casino and is forced to leave her job. She is unable to continue to work in the industry due to her permanent and disabling injury. (1,000 words, APA format and references) Case study: A 64-year old male has been employed as a contractor for an international aid agency for over forty years and has worked in multiple locations across the globe. Ten years ago, the organization paid $125 million to settle a lawsuit in which it was alleged that employees of the organization were involved in a complex sex trafficking scheme, purchasing children as young as 6-7 years old to be sexually assaulted by wealthy western men. The couple has not had children, nor has either wanted to become involved with the adoption or foster care system, but have recently been looking into the process to adopt a child from a foreign country. Recently the organization held a job fair in a third world country and asked its employees to bring their qualified friends to apply for employment with the aid organization. A few weeks before the job fair an employee posted on an organization message board the availability of babies in the area and urged people to consider adopting. The organization has recently become more vigilant in hiring new employees in light of the child prostitution scandal and does not want to accidentally hire someone with a background in sex trafficking. The employee and his wife applied individually and were both hired at the job fair. The organization has begun training for its new employees and was surprised to discover that the couple they hired shared a surname in common with an infamous sex trafficking organization in the country where they were hired. Upon learning of this relation, they began investigating the couple’s background further. The employee denies that he is related to the organization and claims that his is an old and distant family connection that is uncommon that a few dozen people in the country. He and his wife claim they have not met any members of this particular organization in over ten years, if ever. They also claim that they have no previous family connection in the organization and have not been in contact with other members in over a decade. It’s been said that the difference between the first and second person plural pronouns in Spanish is one of the most important grammar differences between English and Spanish, and it is an integral difference between the two languages. It is true, however, that the subject forms between first and third person plurals are only different between Spanish and English in one very important way: The first person plural form of a verb does not change the subject form of a clause. This is because the form of the verb, as well as the subject form of the verb, is what is being changed in the second person singular. The difference here is more important than simply that the subject form changes, since it affects how the subject is viewed throughout the sentence.
The most common mistake students make in class questions is to assume that the subject of a sentence is always in the first person plural. If the subject of a question is always the first person plural, then the first person plural form of the verb (i.e., the verb in the present tense) changes. The subject form of a verb changes when the subject of a sentence changes to the second person singular. For instance, if you are the subject and your teacher is saying how to change a sentence from one subject to another, then you are the second person singular. Similarly, if the subject is the first person singular and you are the subject of a sentence, then you are the first person singular.
Most of the time the teacher will not be teaching you how to change the subject or how to use the second person singular form when the subject changes, but it is important to note that it is not a necessary tool in class questions. The first time you answer a question using the subject form of a sentence, it is always the second person singular (i.e., you are the subject), and the second time you answer a question using the first person singular form (i.e, you are the first person singular), it is always the third person singular (i.e., the third person singular). This is necessary because when you are the subject, it is important that your words are consistent with the rest of the sentence, so that you don’t appear to be saying things that you aren’t.

instruction: In the novel “The Great Gatsby” by F. Scott Fitzgerald, what is the significance of the green light at the end of Daisy’s dock? How does it relate to Gatsby’s dream and his relationship with Daisy? Please provide evidence from the text to support your answer.

combined_input: In the novel “The Great Gatsby” by F. Scott Fitzgerald, what is the significance of the green light at the end of Daisy’s dock? AD: GREEN
GREEN LIGHT A dream is something that occurs to you while you are asleep, and it’s a strong desire or hope for something you cannot reach in reality (Harris, 2020). According to (Harris, 2020) dreams can have a profound influence on people’s beliefs and behaviour. “The Great Gatsby,” a novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald, the green light in the distance represents Gatsby’s goal of being reunited with Daisy Buchanan. Despite all of his attempts to win Buchanan, he is unable to. It is not only a symbol of his dream, but also a sign of frustration (“Green”). Green is a “powerous colour”, according to the Oxford Dictionary (2022, s.v.). Green is also connected to nature and growth (Oxford, n.d.; McArthur, 2021). In the book, he had only this green light in his dream and hopes to get Buchanan to look at it. Because green is linked to nature, Daisy should see it as an indication of nature, which is her, and look at it when the time is right. But, however, she appears to be blind to everything in her dream and not able to see the green or even the person (Carr and Hale, 2019). Her blindness to everything around makes me feel that Gatsby was disappointed in how she responded to his dream. Even though he made it all and was extremely determined to reach her again, he still failed to accomplish his goals. When he returned to East and Buchanan from West, he was still hoping to gain some power and authority despite his disappointment, and was still looking at the green to make Buchanan look at it again (Carr and Hale, 2019). As he got older, his hopefulness waned (Lorensen, 2015). The green light also represents hope. He has never given up on his love for Buchanan despite everything that has happened between them. The green light symbolizes the hope he has for Daisy, and his hopes are never going to go away (Lorensen, 2015). If he does not work hard enough, everything he hopes for will never come true. In the eyes of Gatsby, the sun’s light is a representation of his dream, which is how he was able to become who he is today. His dream will never become a reality, which is probably why this dream was never achieved for him (Carr and Hale, 2019). He was able to get himself to a point of having everything but was still unsuccessful in getting her (“Great”). He was always going to be a bachelor because he thought Buchanan or another person would not look at the light. It’s also the green light, which he believes she is aware of, but doesn’t realise that she has the power to turn the light on or off. This is due to the fact that the green light can be interpreted either way. Despite his hopes, it is clear from reading “The Great Gatsby” that it was difficult for him to reach his dream (Fitzgerald, “The Great”). He tried his best, but was unable to reach his dream (Carr and Hale, 2019). There are many other dreams that Daisy had. She felt “excited and terrified and she loved it” (Fitzgerald as cited by Carr and Hale, 2019). This means that she could not get this dream without hurting others in the process (Fitzgerald as cited by Carr and Hale, 2019). Even though Daisy was a character of the novel, her light at the end of the green line represents the dreams that are not yet fulfilled. The green light is the source of his frustrations when his dream comes undone (Fitzgerald, 2020). Carr and Hale, 2019 and Fitzgerald, F. S. (2014). The Great Gatsby. New York, NY: Penguin Classics.
